org.matsim.core.replanning.modules

Class AbstractMultithreadedModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matsim.core.replanning.modules.AbstractMultithreadedModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PlanStrategyModule, GenericPlanStrategyModule<Plan>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ChangeLegMode, ChangeSingleLegMode, KeepLastExecuted, ReRoute, SubtourModeChoice, TimeAllocationMutator, TransitActsRemoverStrategy, TripsToLegsModule, TripTimeAllocationMutator

    public abstract class AbstractMultithreadedModule
extends Object
implements PlanStrategyModule
    An abstract strategy module for running multiple plan algorithms in parallel. Can be used to easily generate multi-threaded strategy modules, as long as the real functionality of the strategy module is handled by a PlanAlgorithm. Just overwrite getPlanAlgoInstance() to return an instance of your plan algorithm.

    initThreads() creates the threads, but does not yet start them.

    handlePlan(Plan) distributes the plans equally to all threads.

    finishReplanning() finally starts the threads and waits for all threads to be finished.

    While this approach does not lead to optimal performance gains ("slow threads" vs. "fast threads"), it helps building reproducible runs. Additionally, as the threads are only started after all to-be-handled plans are added, we can use unsynchronized data structures.

    Design comments/questions:
    • As a consequence of the design, the instances that getPlanAlgoInstance() returns, need to be thread-safe. kai, dec'12 For an example with discussions, see tutorial.programming.multiThreadedPlanStrategy.RunWithMultithreadedModule
    Author:
    mrieser

    • Method Detail

      • getPlanAlgoInstance

        public abstract PlanAlgorithm getPlanAlgoInstance()
        Design comments:
        • The way I understand this, the instances that this method returns need to be thread-safe (i.e. independent from each other). They can, for example, not rely on the same instance of the router. kai, dec'12

      • prepareReplanning

        public final void prepareReplanning(ReplanningContext replanningContextTmp)
        Description copied from interface: PlanStrategyModule
        Initializes this module before handling plans. Modules using an external routine could e.g. open a file here to write the plans out and pass them to the external routines. Multi-threaded modules could initialize and start their threads in this method.
        Specified by:
        prepareReplanning in interface PlanStrategyModule
        Specified by:
        prepareReplanning in interface GenericPlanStrategyModule<Plan>
        Parameters:

      • handlePlan

        public final void handlePlan(Plan plan)
        Description copied from interface: PlanStrategyModule
        Tells this module to handle the specified plan. It is not required that the plan must immediately be handled, e.g. modules calling external routines could just collect the plans here and start the external routine in PlanStrategyModule.finishReplanning(), or multi-threaded modules could just add the plan to a synchronized queue for the threads.
        Specified by:
        handlePlan in interface PlanStrategyModule
        Specified by:
        handlePlan in interface GenericPlanStrategyModule<Plan>
        See Also:
        PlanStrategyModule.finishReplanning()

      • finishReplanning

        public final void finishReplanning()
        Description copied from interface: PlanStrategyModule
        Indicates that no additional plans will be handed to this module and waits until this module has finished handling all plans. Modules calling external routines can call those here, or multi-threaded modules can wait here until all threads are finished with their work.
        Specified by:
        finishReplanning in interface PlanStrategyModule
        Specified by:
        finishReplanning in interface GenericPlanStrategyModule<Plan>
        See Also:
        PlanStrategyModule.handlePlan(Plan)
